hints.content:
Let's find the pattern that connects each number.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two columns and four rows are shown. The column on the left is labeled Cookies and the column on the right is labeled Eggs. An arrow pointing right appears between the labels Cookies and Eggs. Arrows pointing right appear in each row between each column. The first row shows 1, an arrow pointing right, and 5. The second row shows 2, an arrow pointing right, and 10. The third row shows 3, an arrow pointing right, and 15. The fourth row shows 4, an arrow pointing right, and 20. To the right of the second column, three arrows connect 5 to 10, 10 to 15, and 15 to 20. Each arrow is labeled with a question mark. !

hints.content:
The pattern starts at $5$ and adds $5$ each time.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two columns and four rows are shown. The column on the left is labeled Cookies and the column on the right is labeled Eggs. An arrow pointing right appears between the labels Cookies and Eggs. Arrows pointing right appear in each row between each column. The first row shows 1, an arrow pointing right, and 5. The second row shows 2, an arrow pointing right, and 10. The third row shows 3, an arrow pointing right, and 15. The fourth row shows 4, an arrow pointing right, and 20. To the right of the second column, three arrows connect 5 to 10, 10 to 15, and 15 to 20. Each arrow is labeled with a plus five. !

hints.content:
So, if we want to know how many eggs will be used for $6$ batches of cookies, we need to extend the pattern. 

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two columns and six rows are shown. The column on the left is labeled Cookies and the column on the right is labeled Eggs. An arrow pointing right appears between the labels Cookies and Eggs. Arrows pointing right appear in each row between each column. The first row shows 1, an arrow pointing right, and 5. The second row shows 2, an arrow pointing right, and 10. The third row shows 3, an arrow pointing right, and 15. The fourth row shows 4, an arrow pointing right, and 20. The fifth row shows 5, an arrow pointing right, and 25. The sixth row shows 6, an arrow pointing right, and 30. To the right of the second column, five arrows connect 5 to 10, 10 to 15, 15 to 20, 20 to 25, and 25 to 30. Each arrow is labeled with a plus five. !

hints.content: There will be $30$ eggs used for $6$ batches of cookies.

question.content:
The table below shows the number of eggs used while baking a large batch of cookies.

Cookies | Eggs
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$1$ |$5$
$2$ |$10$
$3$ |$15$
$4$ |$20$

**If the pattern continues, how many eggs will be used for $6$ batches of cookies?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
